channel.title: Samuel Wallan
channel.description: A short portfolio of Sam Wallan's work.

item.title: Undergraduate Research Assistant: SciPy
item.description: Overview As an undergraduate research assistant, I have been contributing to the Scientific Python (“SciPy”) since November of 2019 under…
item.content:encoded:
Overview

As an undergraduate research assistant, I have been contributing to the Scientific Python (“SciPy”) since November of 2019 under various research grants. Under supervision of a professor on campus, I have made enhancements to scipy.stats and scipy.linalg.

Most recently, under the grant, “A Solid Foundation for Statistics in Python with SciPy,” we have worked to make enhancements in several areas to SciPy’s statistical functions. See the full grant proposal here. Most notably, I worked to

  • increase the speed and accuracy of continuous distributions fit methods
  • Addition of the Alexander-Govern statistical test

Under a NumFOCUS grant, we made enhancements to scipy.linalg by wrapping 8 new fortran functions. I participated in this project by creating a parametrized unit test suite for each Fortran Linear Algebra Package (LAPACK) prior to the wrapper being written.

scipy.stats

scipy.linalg

item.content:encoded:
Overview

Enhanced calpolydining.com and calpolycorporation.org

  • Improved static site speed, implemented ADA compliance, updated content and cards Oversaw Marketing and Communications Department technology
  • Repaired Cisco Meraki live content deployments, maintained printer network access and student workstations

item.content:encoded:
Overview

  • Created C++ serial data communication program for embedded vehicle computers
  • Developed general use python data plotting scripts for use by non-software engineers on the team

item.content:encoded:
Overview

  • Built software interface and backend to generate boilerplate webpages and databases for product promotion rather than individual page creation
  • Collaborated with other interns to revitalize consumer point rewards program
